meta.content: College Achieve's mission is to prepare all of its students to excel in and graduate from the top colleges and universities in the nation.

img.alt: Free Subscription to Online Books Featured Photo

div.div: Unlimited and free to use from your home.

h3.a: Coronavirus: An Article from our CEO, Mike Piscal

img.alt: Coronavirus: An Article from our CEO, Mike Piscal Featured Photo

div.div: The CEO of College Achieve Public Schools, pens an article regarding the first week of closure and how this new educational environment impacted our schools.
CACCS students can obtain breakfast and lunch in grab-n-go bags on Mondays and Wednesdays from 9am - 11am at the Westervelt Campus only! Meals will be distributed for entire week.

img.alt: School Closure Preparedness Plan Featured Photo

div.div: Information on CACCS' Distance Learning Plan for School Closure

img.alt: SCHOOL CLOSURE - March 16th - March 27th Featured Photo

div.div: Although CACCS has no confirmed cases of Coronavirus (COVID-19), we are closing the school as a precautionary measure. Effective March 16th, school will be closed for two weeks until March 27th. We will reassess at a later time, if school will reopen on March 30th.
Every College Achieve Central Charter School student will be prepared to excel and graduate from the top colleges and universities in the nation.

We promise that College Achieve will treat you and your child with respect. We promise to recognize and appreciate your child's gifts and talents, and work with you to ensure that they are prepared to succeed in college and in life.
